name: John Snow
contributions: Father of modern epidemiology; traced cholera outbreak in London.

name: Ignaz Semmelweis
contributions: Introduced handwashing in medical practice, reducing puerperal fever.

name: Florence Nightingale
contributions: Pioneer in statistical graphics; improved sanitary practices in hospitals.

name: Edward Jenner
contributions: Developed the first successful smallpox vaccine.

name: Girolamo Fracastoro
contributions: Proposed the germ theory of disease.

name: Sir Richard Doll
contributions: Linked smoking to lung cancer.

name: Alice Stewart
contributions: Researched the dangers of prenatal X-rays and radiation.

name: William Farr
contributions: Founder of medical statistics; systematized recording causes of death.

name: Joseph Goldberger
contributions: Discovered the dietary cause of pellagra.

name: Janet Lane-Claypon
contributions: Pioneer in cancer research, especially breast cancer.

name: Louis Pasteur
contributions: Developed pasteurization and vaccines for rabies and anthrax.

name: Robert Koch
contributions: Identified causative agents of tuberculosis, cholera, and anthrax.

name: Alexander Fleming
contributions: Discovered penicillin.

name: Paul Ehrlich
contributions: Developed first cure for syphilis; advanced immunology.

name: Barbara McClintock
contributions: Discovered transposable elements (jumping genes).

name: Rosalind Franklin
contributions: Contributed to understanding DNA, RNA, viruses.

name: James Watson
contributions: Co-discovered the double-helix structure of DNA.

name: Francis Crick
contributions: Co-discovered the double-helix structure of DNA.

name: Gregor Mendel
contributions: Father of genetics; worked on inheritance of traits in pea plants.

name: Maurice Hilleman
contributions: Developed over 40 vaccines, including for measles and mumps.

name: Katalin Karikó
contributions: Pioneered mRNA technology for COVID-19 vaccines.

name: Ronald Ross
contributions: Discovered malaria parasite in mosquitoes.

name: Max von Pettenkofer
contributions: Promoted sanitation and hygiene in urban areas.

name: Thomas Sydenham
contributions: English Hippocrates; emphasized clinical observation.

name: Andreas Vesalius
contributions: Founder of modern human anatomy.

name: Hippocrates
contributions: Father of Medicine; Hippocratic Oath.

name: William Harvey
contributions: Described the circulation of blood.

name: Alfred Grotjahn
contributions: Pioneer in social hygiene and social medicine.

name: Alfred Blalock
contributions: Developed the first successful open heart surgery techniques.

name: Harvey Cushing
contributions: Pioneer of brain surgery techniques.

name: Norman Bethune
contributions: Pioneered mobile blood transfusion services.

name: Elie Metchnikoff
contributions: Father of natural immunity; discovered phagocytosis.

name: Henry Gray
contributions: Authored 'Gray's Anatomy', a comprehensive anatomical reference.

name: Walter Reed
contributions: Proved mosquitoes transmit yellow fever.

name: Karl Landsteiner
contributions: Discovered blood groups, making transfusions safe.

name: Albert Sabin
contributions: Developed oral polio vaccine.

name: Jonas Salk
contributions: Developed the first effective polio vaccine.

name: Jean-Martin Charcot
contributions: Founder of modern neurology; studied multiple sclerosis.

name: Joseph Lister
contributions: Pioneer of antiseptic surgery.

name: Antonie van Leeuwenhoek
contributions: Father of microbiology; improved the microscope.

name: Mary Leakey
contributions: Discovered important hominid fossils in Africa.

name: Richard Leakey
contributions: Discovered early human fossils.

name: Melinda Gates
contributions: Global health and education initiatives.

name: Bill Gates
contributions: Global health and technology innovations.

name: Margaret Mead
contributions: Studies of culture and personality in Pacific Islands.

name: Franz Boas
contributions: Father of American anthropology; cultural relativism.

name: Émile Durkheim
contributions: Founder of sociology; studied social facts and institutions.

name: Max Weber
contributions: Theory of social action, the protestant ethic, and the spirit of capitalism.

name: Karl Marx
contributions: Developed the theory of Marxism; wrote 'Das Kapital'.

name: Herbert Spencer
contributions: Social Darwinism; coined 'survival of the fittest'.

name: William James
contributions: Father of American psychology; pragmatism.

name: Sigmund Freud
contributions: Founder of psychoanalysis; theories on the unconscious mind.

name: Carl Jung
contributions: Analytical psychology; concepts of archetypes and collective unconscious.

name: Alfred Adler
contributions: Individual psychology; concepts of inferiority complex.

name: Jean Piaget
contributions: Theory of cognitive development in children.

name: B.F. Skinner
contributions: Operant conditioning; behaviorism.

name: Ivan Pavlov
contributions: Classical conditioning; famous for Pavlov's dogs.

name: Carl Rogers
contributions: Client-centered therapy; human potential movement.

name: Abraham Maslow
contributions: Maslow's hierarchy of needs.

name: Wilhelm Wundt
contributions: Father of experimental psychology; founded the first psychology lab.

name: Gustav Fechner
contributions: Founder of psychophysics; studied the relationship between stimuli and sensation.

name: Alfred Binet
contributions: Developed the first practical intelligence test.

name: Lev Vygotsky
contributions: Sociocultural theory; studied children's cognitive development.

name: William Tuke
contributions: Promoted humane treatment of the mentally ill; established the York Retreat.
